Author: gimmethatdamnavocado
Text: I’m performing really well during my workouts actually. But I do take pre-workouts and I’m very mentally driven to give it all during my workouts. I do have issues sleeping and have been experiencing frequent headaches.

Author: invincibletitan33
Text: I'd say if you are exercising that often, then 1600 calories is not enough.   Listen to your body, are you finding that you are lacking in energy and tired? Or you're getting lightheaded and dizzy during or after workouts? Or you're finding it hard during workouts and your performance isn't great? If so, you're still probably not eating enough.  Also when you aren't eating enough and you're doing lots of training, your body will prioritise your energy for movement, so other things like your immune system, digestive system and hormone function (which is why women lose periods) get impacted by lack of energy and they will decrease.  You should check out this podcast, it was eye-opening for me: https://www.bbc.co.uk/sounds/play/p07bn6np
